input:
Problem: if a certain coin is flipped , the probability that the coin will land heads is 1 / 2 . if the coin is flipped 5 times , what is the probability that it will land heads up on the first 3 flips and not on the last 2 flips ? 
Options: a ) 3 / 5 , b ) 1 / 2 , c ) 1 / 5 , d ) 1 / 8 , e ) 1 / 32

Problem: there are 25 balls in a jar . you take out 5 blue balls without putting them back inside , and now the probability of pulling out a blue ball is 1 / 5 . how many blue balls were there in the beginning ? 
Options: a ) 12 . , b ) 9 . , c ) 8 . , d ) 7 . , e ) 6 .

Problem: how many different ways can 2 students be seated in a row of 5 desks , so that there is always at least one empty desk between the students ? 
Options: a ) 2 , b ) 3 , c ) 4 , d ) 6 , e ) 12

Problem: what is the probability of getting a sum 9 from two throw of a dice ? 
Options: a ) 1 / 6 , b ) 1 / 8 , c ) 1 / 9 , d ) 1 / 12 , e ) 1 / 13

Problem: a bag consists of 20 marbles , of which 5 are blue , 9 are red , and the remainder are white . if lisa is to select a marble from the bag at random , what is the probability that the marble will be red or white ? 
Options: a ) 3 / 4 , b ) 2 / 4 , c ) 1 / 4 , d ) 1 / 8 , e ) 1 / 16

Problem: in a garden , there are yellow and green flowers which are straight and curved . if the probability of picking a green flower is 3 / 4 and picking a straight flower is 1 / 2 , then what is the probability of picking a flower which is yellow and curved 
Options: a ) 1 / 8 , b ) 1 / 6 , c ) 1 / 4 , d ) 3 / 4 , e ) 7 / 8

Problem: a box contains 3 red balls and 3 black balls . one by one , every ball is selected at random without replacement . what is the probability that the fourth ball selected is black ? 
Options: a ) 1 / 4 , b ) 1 / 2 , c ) 1 / 2 , d ) 2 , e ) 2 / 3

Problem: find the probability that a non leap year selected at random will have 53 sundays 
Options: a ) 6 / 7 , b ) 5 / 7 , c ) 4 / 7 , d ) 3 / 7 , e ) 1 / 7

Problem: in a certain animal population , for each of the first 3 months of life , the probability that an animal will die during that month is 1 / 10 . for a group of 500 newborn members of the population , approximately how many would be expected to survive the first 3 months of life ? 
Options: a ) 340 , b ) 346 , c ) 352 , d ) 365 , e ) 370

Problem: a bag contains 6 black and 5 white balls . one ball is drawn at random . what is the probability that the ball drawn is white ? 
Options: a ) 3 / 4 , b ) 5 / 11 , c ) 1 / 7 , d ) 1 / 8 , e ) 4 / 3

Problem: a meeting has to be conducted with 4 managers . find the number of ways in which the managers may be selected from among 8 managers , if there are 2 managers who refuse to attend the meeting together . 
Options: a ) 48 , b ) 55 , c ) 58 , d ) 62 , e ) 70

Problem: 4 dices are thrown at the same time . what is the probability of getting only 2 dices showing the same face ? 
Options: a ) 4 / 9 , b ) 5 / 9 , c ) 11 / 18 , d ) 7 / 9 , e ) none of the above

Problem: the set s consists of 5 numbers : { 1 , 2,3 , 4,5 } . if all possible subsets including the null set are created and one subset is chosen at random , what is the probability that the subset has 4 or 5 as its largest number ? 
Options: a ) 1 / 2 , b ) 2 / 3 , c ) 3 / 4 , d ) 5 / 8 , e ) 11 / 16

Problem: in a certain animal population , for each of the first 3 months of life , the probability that an animal will die during that month is 1 / 10 . for a group of 200 newborn members of the population , approximately how many would be expected to survive the first 3 months of life ? 
Options: a ) 140 , b ) 146 , c ) 152 , d ) 162 , e ) 170

Problem: what is the probability of drawing a queen from a deck of 52 cards ? 
Options: a ) 4 / 13 , b ) 1 / 13 , c ) 4 , d ) 1 , e ) 2 / 13

Problem: a box contains 25 electric bulbs , out of which 4 are defective . two bulbs are chosen at random from this box . the probability that at least one of these is defective is 
Options: a ) 3 / 10 , b ) 7 / 19 , c ) 12 / 19 , d ) 21 / 95 , e ) none

Problem: a card is drawn from a pack of 52 cards . the probability of not getting a face card ? 
Options: a ) 9 / 13 , b ) 5 / 12 , c ) 3 / 13 , d ) 6 / 17 , e ) 1 / 13

Problem: there are 13 boys and 10 girls in a class . if three students are selected at random , in how many ways that 1 girl & 2 boys are selected ? 
Options: a ) 120 , b ) 480 , c ) 780 , d ) 720 , e ) 800

Problem: a box contains 20 electric bulbs , out of which 4 are defective . two bulbs are chosen at random from this box . the probability that at least one of these is defective is 
Options: a ) 7 / 19 , b ) 6 / 19 , c ) 5 / 19 , d ) 4 / 19 , e ) none of these

Problem: a box contains 100 balls , numbered from 1 to 100 . if 3 balls are selected at random and with replacement from the box . if the 3 numbers on the balls selected contain two odd and one even . what is the probability z that the first ball picked up is odd numbered ? 
Options: a ) 0 , b ) 1 / 3 , c ) 1 / 2 , d ) 2 / 3 , e ) 1

Problem: a bag contains 3 red , 5 yellow and 7 green balls . 3 balls are drawn randomly . what is the probability that the balls drawn contain balls of different colours ? 
Options: a ) 2 / 7 , b ) 3 / 5 , c ) 3 / 13 , d ) 1 / 4 , e ) 7 / 16

Problem: when 3 fair coins are tossed together , what is the probability of getting 2 tails ? 
Options: a ) 1 / 2 , b ) 1 / 3 , c ) 1 / 4 , d ) 3 / 4 , e ) 2 / 3

Problem: there are 9 pairs of socks and 2 socks are worn from that such that the pair of socks worn are not of the same pair . what is the number of pair that can be formed . 
Options: a ) 62 , b ) 70 , c ) 72 , d ) 71 , e ) 76

Problem: what is the probability of getting only 1 head in a single throw of four fair coins ? 
Options: a ) 1 / 2 , b ) 3 / 8 , c ) 1 / 4 , d ) 1 / 5 , e ) 5 / 8

Problem: a box contains 100 balls , numbered from 1 to 100 . if 3 balls are selected at random and with replacement from the box . if the 3 numbers on the balls selected contain two odd and one even . what is the probability l that the first ball picked up is odd numbered ? 
Options: a ) 0 , b ) 1 / 3 , c ) 1 / 2 , d ) 2 / 3 , e ) 1

Problem: six 6 faced dice are thrown together . the probability that all the three show the same number on them is ? 
Options: a ) 1 / 32 , b ) 1 / 7776 , c ) 1 / 33 , d ) 1 / 38 , e ) 1 / 34

Problem: find the probability that a leap year selected at random will have 53 sundays 
Options: a ) 6 / 7 , b ) 5 / 7 , c ) 4 / 7 , d ) 3 / 7 , e ) 2 / 7

Problem: there is a 20 % chance sandy will visit china this year , while there is a 70 % chance that she will visit malaysia this year . what is the probability that sandy will visit either china or malaysia this year , but not both ? 
Options: a ) 44 % , b ) 48 % , c ) 54 % , d ) 62 % , e ) 70 %

Problem: what is the probability that carol and bernie will get selected for a job they both applied for in a company , given that their chances of getting selected is 4 / 5 and 3 / 5 respectively ? 
Options: a ) 8 / 25 , b ) 11 / 24 , c ) 12 / 25 , d ) 12 / 25 , e ) 12 / 23

Problem: if you throw two dice at a same time . can you find the probability of getting sum as 10 of the two numbers shown ? 
Options: a ) 1 / 16 , b ) 2 / 14 , c ) 1 / 12 , d ) 1 / 19 , e ) 1 / 17

Problem: if a coin has an equal probability of landing heads up or tails up each time it is flipped , what is the probability that the coin will land heads up exactly once in 3 consecutive flips ? 
Options: a ) 0.125 , b ) 0.25 , c ) 0.75 , d ) 0.375 , e ) 0.666

Problem: a box contains 2 red balls and 5 black balls . one by one , every ball is selected at random without replacement . what is the probability that the fourth ball selected is black ? 
Options: a ) 1 / 4 , b ) 7 / 5 , c ) 1 / 2 , d ) 5 / 8 , e ) 2 / 3

Problem: a box contains 24 electric bulbs , out of which 4 are defective . two bulbs are chosen at random from this box . the probability that at least one of these is defective is 
Options: a ) 4 / 19 , b ) 7 / 19 , c ) 12 / 19 , d ) 24 / 77 , e ) none

Problem: in a throw of dice what is the probability of ge æ « ing number greater than 2 
Options: a ) 2 / 3 , b ) 1 / 3 , c ) 1 / 5 , d ) 1 / 6 , e ) none of these

Problem: how many positive integers less than 600 can be formed using the numbers 1 , 2 , 3 , 5 and 6 for the digits ? 
Options: a ) 48 , b ) 130 , c ) 66 , d ) 68 , e ) 84

Problem: x , y , and z are all unique numbers . if x is chosen randomly from the set { 6 , 7 , 8 , 9 , 10 , 11 } and y and z are chosen randomly from the set { 20 , 21 , 22 , 23 } , what is the probability that x and y are prime and z is not ? 
Options: a ) 1 / 5 , b ) 3 / 20 , c ) 2 / 15 , d ) 1 / 12 , e ) 1 / 10

Problem: there are 18 balls in a jar . you take out 3 blue balls without putting them back inside , and now the probability of pulling out a blue ball is 1 / 5 . how many blue balls were there in the beginning ? 
Options: a ) 12 , b ) 9 , c ) 8 , d ) 7 , e ) 6

Problem: the set s consists of 5 numbers : { 1 , 2,3 , 4,5 } . if all possible subsets including the null set are created and one subset is chosen at random , what is the probability that the subset has 3 or 4 as its largest number ? 
Options: a ) 3 / 4 , b ) 3 / 8 , c ) 3 / 16 , d ) 5 / 16 , e ) 3 / 32

Problem: tomeka is playing a dice game . if she rolls the same number on her second roll as she rolls on her first , she wins . each roll is with two , fair , 6 - sided dice . if tomeka rolled a 7 on her first roll , what is the probability that she will win on her second roll ? 
Options: a ) 1 / 4 , b ) 1 / 5 , c ) 1 / 6 , d ) 1 / 9 , e ) 1 / 12

Problem: the membership of a committee consists of 3 english teachers , 4 mathematics teachers , and 3 social studies teachers . if 2 committee members are to be selected at random to write the committee ’ s report , what is the probability that the two members selected will both be english teachers ? 
Options: a ) 2 / 3 , b ) 1 / 3 , c ) 2 / 9 , d ) 1 / 12 , e ) 1 / 24

Problem: in a garden , there are yellow and green flowers which are straight and curved . if the probability of picking a green flower is 1 / 5 and picking a straight flower is 1 / 2 , then what is the probability of picking a flower which is yellow and straight 
Options: a ) 1 / 7 , b ) 1 / 8 , c ) 2 / 5 , d ) 3 / 4 , e ) 7 / 8

Problem: in lottery , there are 10 prizes and 25 blanks . a lottery is drawn at random . what is the probability of getting a prize ? 
Options: a ) 1 / 7 , b ) 2 / 7 , c ) 3 / 7 , d ) 4 / 7 , e ) 1

Problem: in a lottery there are 20 prizes and 35 blanks . a lottery is drawn at random . what is the probability of getting a prize 
Options: a ) 2 / 13 , b ) 4 / 11 , c ) 5 / 11 , d ) 6 / 11 , e ) 3 / 13

Problem: a meeting has to be conducted with 5 managers . find the number of ways in which the managers may be selected from among 7 managers , if there are 2 managers who refuse to attend the meeting together . 
Options: a ) 6 , b ) 8 , c ) 10 , d ) 11 , e ) 15

Problem: from a pack of cards , two cards are drawn one after the other , with replacement . what is the probability that the first card is a club and the second card is a king ? 
Options: a ) 2 / 13 , b ) 1 / 26 , c ) 5 / 26 , d ) 1 / 52 , e ) 17 / 52

Problem: there are two bags a and b . a contains 6 red flowers and 3 pink flowers . where as bag b contains 2 red flowers and 7 pink flowers . one flower is chosen from a bag randomly . what is the probability that the flower chosen is pink ? 
Options: a ) 5 / 8 , b ) 5 / 6 , c ) 5 / 1 , d ) 5 / 9 , e ) 5 / 2

Problem: x , y , and z are all unique numbers . if x is chosen randomly from the set { 9 , 10 , 11 } and y and z are chosen randomly from the set { 20 , 21 , 22 , 23 } , what is the probability that x and y are prime and z is not ? 
Options: a ) 1 / 20 , b ) 1 / 12 , c ) 2 / 15 , d ) 3 / 10 , e ) 1 / 7

Problem: a meeting has to be conducted with 4 managers . find the number of ways in which the managers be selected from among 7 managers , if 2 managers will not attend the meeting together ? 
Options: a ) 25 , b ) 20 , c ) 35 , d ) 36 , e ) 38

Problem: in a certain animal population , for each of the first 3 months of life , the probability that an animal will die during that month is 1 / 10 . for a group of 300 newborn members of the population , approximately how many would be expected to survive the first 3 months of life ? 
Options: a ) 219 , b ) 246 , c ) 252 , d ) 262 , e ) 270

Problem: what is the probability of drawn an ace or a space or both from a dew of cards . 
Options: a ) 14 / 52 , b ) 15 / 52 , c ) 16 / 52 , d ) 17 / 52 , e ) 18 / 52
